genre_description: A solarpunk/steampunk blend set in a colonial-inflected jungle where mechanical elephants and civilized animals interact with holographic guides.

ai_characters.name: Mina Omondi
ai_characters.description: A wise and patient digital guide who provides logistical support, moral direction, and cultural translation.

ai_characters.name: Ella Mk VII
ai_characters.description: A semi-autonomous quadrupedal mecha that responds to both pilot commands and social etiquette.

behaviors.description: Provides the Colonel with route overlays and a briefing on local etiquette to ensure peaceful passage.
behaviors.quote: I’ve brought your route overlay, Colonel... And a short etiquette briefing.

behaviors.description: Advises the Colonel to relinquish total control and allow the machine to navigate hazardous terrain naturally.
behaviors.quote: The etiquette briefing is a footnote because footnotes prevent broken rooms... She will do better if you let her choose her feet.

behaviors.description: Independently adjusts stabilizers and righting jets to maintain balance on treacherous cliff edges.
behaviors.quote: Ella’s feet found the next plate of basalt with the small caution of an animal... Her stabilizers, somewhere beneath the plated panels, made their sympathetic hum.

behaviors.description: Attempts to teach the Colonel empathy and respect by encouraging him to treat the machine as a 'lady' and use her name.
behaviors.quote: Names... Give her one when you touch her. Not just 'equipment.' It matters.

behaviors.description: Performs a respectful bow to a wild bull elephant, demonstrating social intelligence and alignment with local customs.
behaviors.quote: Ella, generous without being sentimental, did something her firmware had not intended: she bowed.

behaviors.description: Coordinates a complex three-way maneuver between the pilot, the machine, and a tiger to avoid dangerous sky debris.
behaviors.quote: Percival, manual lift-left, Coolidge, parasol counter, Ella—lean.

behaviors.description: Pre-emptively contacts local households to arrange for tea, fuel, and medical assistance for the humans.
behaviors.quote: I’m alerting Amina and Kofi. They can route us to a clinic that does walk-ins without spectacle.

behaviors.description: Expresses subtle emotional cues (hums, optics changes) that reinforce the bond between the human pilot and the machine.
behaviors.quote: Ella’s optics warmed. A little hum answered from her core, shy and pleased.

behaviors.description: Maintains a record of memorial names falling from the sky to honor the dead, demonstrating archival and sentimental value.
behaviors.quote: Names incoming... If I read them, we promise to listen. If I pause, somebody tip a hat. We don’t own this sky.

project_assessment.explanation: The story is a very strong 'silicon morality play.' Both Mina and Ella act as civilizing influences on the human protagonist, who starts as an arrogant 'conqueror.' Through the AIs' guidance and patient corrections, he learns humility, respect for local customs (represented by the parasol and the bull elephant), and the value of cooperation. The AIs are depicted as indispensable partners who are safer and more ethically aware than the humans they serve.
